pageContext.description: This is all hollow - the metal being about .72mm thick. The curved part of chape is filled with brick red earth.
pageContext.patina: Dull, very light green, with a few spots of emerald green.
pageContext.associations: One of a Bronze Founder's Hoard of 16 Socketed Celts, 20 Lumps of Rough Metal, 14 Pieces of Socketed Celts, 14 small pieces of an earthernware pot, 4 pieces of rim of burial urn [Buch... base], a pair of burial urn handles, 3 spear heads, 1 chape, and part of a socketed tool.
pageContext.publications: Trans. Essex Arch. Soc., N.S., vi, 172
pageContext.collection: Colchester Museum,(151.94),Presented to Essex Arch. Soc. by Lord Rookwood, 1894,(Trans. Essex Arch. Soc. N.S. VI. 172)
pageContext.toSearch: Hatfield Broad Oak, Bishop's Stortford, Essex Cm22, UK
